<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">namespace </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A simple intrusive list implementation.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is a simple intrusive list for a \\c T that inherits from \\c</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ilist&#95;node&lt;T&gt;.  The list never takes ownership of anything inserted in it.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Unlike \\a iplist&lt;T&gt; and \\a ilist&lt;T&gt;, \\a simple&#95;ilist&lt;T&gt; never deletes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">/// values, and has no callback traits.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The API for adding nodes include \\a push&#95;front(), \\a push&#95;back(), and \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">/// insert().  These all take values by reference (not by pointer), except for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the range version of \\a insert().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">/// There are three sets of API for discarding nodes from the list: \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">/// remove(), which takes a reference to the node to remove, \\a erase(), which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">/// takes an iterator or iterator range and returns the next one, and \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">/// clear(), which empties out the container.  All three are constant time</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">/// operations.  None of these deletes any nodes; in particular, if there is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">/// single node in the list, then these have identical semantics:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\li \\c L.remove(L.front());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\li \\c L.erase(L.begin());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\li \\c L.clear();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// As a convenience for callers, there are parallel APIs that take a \\c</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Disposer (such as \\c std::default&#95;delete&lt;T&gt;): \\a removeAndDispose(), \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">/// eraseAndDispose(), and \\a clearAndDispose().  These have different names</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">/// because the extra semantic is otherwise non-obvious.  They are equivalent</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to calling \\a std::for&#95;each() on the range to be discarded.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The currently available \\p Options customize the nodes in the list.  The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">/// same options must be specified in the \\a ilist&#95;node instantiation for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">/// compatibility (although the order is irrelevant).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\li Use \\a ilist&#95;tag to designate which ilist&#95;node for a given \\p T this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">/// list should use.  This is useful if a type \\p T is part of multiple,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">/// independent lists simultaneously.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\li Use \\a ilist&#95;sentinel&#95;tracking to always (or never) track whether a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">/// node is a sentinel.  Specifying \\c true enables the \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ilist&#95;node::isSentinel() API.  Unlike \\a ilist&#95;node::isKnownSentinel(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which is only appropriate for assertions, \\a ilist&#95;node::isSentinel() is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">/// appropriate for real logic.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Here are examples of \\p Options usage:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\li \\c simple&#95;ilist&lt;T&gt; gives the defaults.  \\li \\c</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">/// simple&#95;ilist&lt;T,ilist&#95;sentinel&#95;tracking&lt;true&gt;&gt; enables the \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ilist&#95;node::isSentinel() API.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\li \\c simple&#95;ilist&lt;T,ilist&#95;tag&lt;A&gt;,ilist&#95;sentinel&#95;tracking&lt;false&gt;&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">/// specifies a tag of A and that tracking should be off (even when</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">/// LLVM&#95;ENABLE&#95;ABI&#95;BREAKING&#95;CHECKS are enabled).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\li \\c simple&#95;ilist&lt;T,ilist&#95;sentinel&#95;tracking&lt;false&gt;,ilist&#95;tag&lt;A&gt;&gt; is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">/// equivalent to the last.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">/// See \\a is&#95;valid&#95;option for steps on adding a new option.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">... <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/logicalview/lib/debuginfo/logicalview/core/lvoptions-cpp/#ab4088b7a11f3cbc38ac16a6e9c72494e">Options</a>&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/simple-ilist"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/simple-ilist/#aa4d5d2d0c3d7d2305b8ca6808d337f73">simple&#95;ilist</a></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="normal">                </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Unrecognized node option!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
